sources.title: The Scalphunters (1967) Burt Lancaster · Shelley Winters
sources.description: A rugged trapper, forced to trade his valuable furs for a well-behaved, escaped slave, vows to retrieve the furs from the Indians and later from the renegades who killed them..  An elegantly staged Western that reflects the political climate of the 1960s: after initially promoting violence as a legitimate means of combating oppression, the conciliatory ending weakens this thrust.

metadata.Plot: Trapper Joe is on his way to the town with all of his gain of hides of the last winter. However a group of Indians stops him and takes all of his hides, leaving him the escaped slave Joseph instead. But Joe has no use for Joseph and is determined to get his property back and follows them. Before he can do anything, the Indians are raided themselves by a group of scalphunters under the greedy Howie. Not only the hides, but also Joseph falls into their hands. Now Joe follows them alone and tries to trick the numerical superior group out of his hides.
metadata.Actors: Burt Lancaster, Shelley Winters, Telly Savalas
